import Mathlib

/-- Suppose U âŠ‚ â„‚ is open, and Ïˆ : U Ã— [0,1] â†’ â„‚ is continuous such that for each fixed t âˆˆ [0,1], z â†¦ Ïˆ(z,t) is holomorphic. Then h(z) = âˆ«_0^1 Ïˆ(z,t) dt is holomorphic on U. -/

    HolomorphicOn (fun z => âˆ« (t : â„) in 0 .. 1, Ïˆ (z, t)) U := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Set Filter Metric Complex MeasureTheory
open scoped Topology

/-- Suppose U âŠ‚ â„‚ is open, Ïˆ : â„‚ Ã— â„ â†’ â„‚ continuous on U Ã— [0,1], and for each t in [0,1], z â†¦ Ïˆ(z,t) is DifferentiableOn â„‚ on U. Then the function z â†¦ âˆ«_{0}^{1} Ïˆ(z,t) dt is DifferentiableOn â„‚ on U. -/
theorem differentiableOn_complex_integral {U : Set â„‚} (hU : IsOpen U) (Ïˆ : â„‚ Ã— â„ â†’ â„‚)
    (hÏˆ : ContinuousOn Ïˆ (U Ã—Ë¢ (Set.Icc (0 : â„) 1))) (hÏˆ' : âˆ€ t âˆˆ Set.Icc (0 : â„) 1, DifferentiableOn â„‚ (fun z => Ïˆ (z, t)) U) :
    DifferentiableOn â„‚ (fun z => MeasureTheory.integral (Measure.restrict MeasureTheory.MeasureSpace.volume (Set.Icc (0 : â„) 1)) (fun t => Ïˆ (z, t))) U := by sorry
